website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive and great at covering a wide area between charges, the e5 is an effective cleaner that lacks the smarter tech of newer Roombas.
pros: Automatically docks and fully charges in 90 minutes
Traps 99% of dog and cat allergens
cons: The e5 isn’t as good at cleaning up to wall edges as advanced models

customer_reviews.title: Sucks - But Has A Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: Used to last an hour or so. Now dies after 30 minutes. We've had it two weeks. Definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Too small of a chamber for a pet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Roomba because it says it is ideal for pet hair. The problem is it doesn’t have a large enough chamber to vacuum the house (less than 1000 sqft). It would be great if we had a studio apartment, but this product is worthless if you set it to clean while you are at work. Once it fills up the tiny chamber, it just starts spreading the pet hair and dirt all over the rugs. This product should say “not ideal” for pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: The charger will fail soon. Don't buy a roomba.
customer_reviews.text: We should have known better since the chargers we had for an earlier roomba failed multiple times but we were enchanted by the concept of not having to sweep the floor. The roomba works if you could only charge it. The charger failed on our second roomba after only 3 months. One would think that irobot would have figured out how to make or buy a reliable charger and for the price they charge for an E5 they could certainly afford to do so.
customer_reviews.author: mary nine

customer_reviews.title: They are sending an extractor cleaning kit to repair suction deficiency?
customer_reviews.text: Have had this just over two months. No suction. Called for return and spent over a half hour on phone to be told even though I’ve cleaned it multiply times and it’s not working correctly they won’t exchange it at this time. I will buy such products only from Costco in the future. They stand behind items purchased at their stores.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson H.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Too good to be true. First it forgot where HOME is, then it started missing big sections of the room, ran out of battery under an hour, the last run it didn’t pick up anything!!! All this in a month.
customer_reviews.author: DivaDome

customer_reviews.title: Worthless on dog hair on Berber carpet
customer_reviews.text: This thing leaves a trail of dog fur behind it when “cleaning” my Berber carpet. And it’s bounce navigation is pointless for a larger home. Our 1400 sq ft main floor would probably require three charges to complete. But I sent it back before it got that far.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Roomba
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Roomba that I have had. By far, it’s the best. The brushes are rubber and have no bristles so hair does not get wound around them and have to be cleaned constantly. The dirt bin can be cleaned by rinsing in the sink. It very rarely gets stuck on uneven surfaces. Huge improvement over the ones that I had in the past. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck, gets lost, not worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this Roomba for the first few days I had it, but unfortunately for the price point and given its flaws I have to return it. She is drunk and gets stuck EVERYWHERE. She is noisy. She can never find home base. She randomly spins in circles. I am disappointed that with all the technology we have in the world today we can not have better vacuums. I'd rather just plug in a vacuum cleaner a few times per week and handle it myself, it saves much time and energy!
customer_reviews.author: californiam

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully quiet ! Excellent vacuum.Love it !
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Rhoomba. My first still works fine but a bit noisy. I LOVE how helpful they are. We have 2 dogs that live inside and out with us. It is totally amazing how much fur sheds during the different seasons. This model is so much quieter and the 2 rubber Rollers are a great improvement over the brush roller. I have to spend about 30 minutes cleaning all the hair and carpet debris off the older model. Also the catchment compartment had to be cleaned everything 30 min. of operation. This one just pops open and empties easier. Good progressive design. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: P. V. Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea but not well executed. It can't find it's way home, iRobot runs about twenty minutes and the battery is down to 1/4 charge, clean the bin after ever use, clean filter every week and replace every 2 months, clean roller every two weeks replace every 12 months, clean edge sweep brush every month replace every 12 months, battery life is 8 to 10 months. When all said and done this becomes a very expensive and time consuming vacuum, you are better off with a traditional type vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete job
customer_reviews.text: If you want a vacuum that randomly cleans your floors then this is the one. There is no specific pattern it uses to vacuum the floors, it randomly goes everywhere and doesn’t complete any section of flooring. For the money I spent I thought it was going to flow back and forth to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works on regular carpets
customer_reviews.text: We originally ordered another brand and were disappointed with how it did on carpets. I am so excited with our new machine we named Fred! It has no issues with cleaning out carpets and we have 3 small dogs. This is such a game changer for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa McElhinney

customer_reviews.title: I have owned Roombas before and swore by them, but this model is awful.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 4 Roombas and have generally been satisfied. I returned this one. It was not able to move easily from hard floor to a tight woven rug. It's guidance system seemed terrible. It would often just clean a small section of the hard floor for a few minutes then return to the base, missing most of the room. When you removed it fully charged and placed it on the rug to start it, the battery light went immediately to yellow. I was completely unsatisfied and will try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan D. Gatewood

customer_reviews.title: Great suction power, works on carpet.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy a robot vacuum for fear it would not work on my carpet, or that it would not have powerful enough suction. I am completely satisfied with this vacuum. It runs for about an hour and finds its way back to the base most of thie time. I have ran it everyday for the last 4 days and the dirt cup is full everytime, it is getting dirt that my upright did not! It is very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Marlie

customer_reviews.title: The house is cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Roomba!! We've had a mint for several years and it has worked just fine...in fact we still use it. It doesn't compare to the cleaning power of this Roomba. We're still getting use to it and fixing places that it gets stuck. It does extremely well in our house. Sometimes it hits one of the rocking recliners and it's just enough to raise the recliner and get the poor Roomba stuck under it. Overall, we are very satisfied with its performance. It runs about 90 minutes, then goes and charges itself! I highly recommend these and hope you like it as much as we do!
customer_reviews.author: Steven DesLauriers

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it at all
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes for the roomba. We have an open concept first floor, all wood. The roomba random pattern might as well be useless. After running for an hour the floor still had spots the vacuum never touched. Extremely disappointed in this and the cost. Would love to return but having problems with amazon return for this.
customer_reviews.author: Kate McBride

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have purchased one sooner!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It’s been a timesaver to use to keep my wood floors clean of dog hair and food crumbs. I’m a working mom with 3 kids and a dog and it’s been the best purchase. I couldn’t believe how it got the dirt and debris around the legs of chairs and table. I did have to call support once since purchasing it a few months prior and they were very helpful and friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Pam B.

customer_reviews.title: Not like the older ones
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum frequently gets stuck transitioning between carpet and tile, or runs into furniture and can't get around it. But the worst part is that it doesn't give any error message, it just shuts off. So one never knows whether it actually finished a room, or ran for 2 minutes and shut off because it was stuck. Also, they let the designers have free rein here so maybe they think all the black looks cool. But the usability is an issue because it's harder to find the handle, and harder to locate the opening to remove the waste container
customer_reviews.author: Patricia D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Just Few Things to Watch Out For
customer_reviews.text: Mostly, this is a great little vacuum. But it has a few quirks that you will want to know to help you enjoy it. 1-Do not leave it on its docking charger when/if the power goes out. For some reason, our Roomba will discharge and not recharge when the power comes back on. 2-If you get an Error 6, as I do occasionally, remove and reinstall the battery. 3-As often as possible, have the Roomba drive itself onto the charging stand. 4-if you are not using the Roomba for a week or more, vacation or something, remove the battery. Understanding these quirks has helped me better enjoy the Roomba. Have fun, it’s a nice automated cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Timmp

customer_reviews.title: Did not like it. Too big. Crashed Into Everything. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.text: I know people love these machines. I have friends and family that do. But it wasn't my cup of tea. It's a lot bigger than I thought. It kept crashing into things or just going in circles. And freaked my dogs out, so I sent it back after a week. So granted, I didn't try it for long but I just did not like it. Return and refund process was easy. I just dropped it off at a location that accepts refund items for free. So no packing or shipping cost to send it back. So that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Alan P.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Roomba!! It does great cleaning up my dog’s fur. Only occasionally has it gotten stuck or not made it back to the dock. Cant believe I went without one for so long!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works really well! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This really does clean very well and has made our daily cleaning routine a lot easier. Ours sometimes has trouble charging so I just clean the silver parts on the bottom of the unit and the charger dock with a magic eraser and that does the trick. In these situations you can see black spots on the silver parts that are interfering with it charging properly. Of note you do need to buy replacement filters and brushes for this periodically so factor that into the cost of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Lfc 19

customer_reviews.title: Worst Item Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have moved this items station thru out the entire house and it never remembers where it went prior and it usually stay in a area that is 4ft x4ft. I truly hate this thing but my wife keeps trying over and over hoping it will work. She won't return it thinking...it might work someday! Yes...we have kept it clean for it's censors and kept emptying when it collects dust. Si I don't want the manufacturer writing ...are you sure your doing everything that I'm suppose to be doing.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID8869

customer_reviews.title: Roomba Good, App Bad
customer_reviews.text: The Roomba is great, but the app is not so great. Every time Roomba finishes cleaning, regardless of the reason (error, canceled, complete, etc.) the app reports that the clean was canceled.
customer_reviews.author: ipr151

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in multiple rooms
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great idea, problem is it will get stuck in a room and just go around and around cleaning the same areas never to leave the room until it is out of battery. I would say there is a lot to be improved on this unit. If you have to place in each room you clean defeats the purpose of the robot in the first place. Do NOT buy this unless you live in a very small one room house.
customer_reviews.author: Hap1967

customer_reviews.title: Many Advances Since Last Roomba
customer_reviews.text: There have been many advances since the last Roomba that I owned, and this one does well overall with picking up dog hair, even on carpet. However.... LOL.... Although it picks up dog hair very well, the bin is small and it reaches capacity quickly. If you've waited too long between vacuuming, you might have to run it a couple of times to get everything. It runs a long time, well past an hour most of the time. It can get stuck without being able to find its charging station, if you've put the charging station in an out of the way location. This is to be expected. The iPhone application works well for planning, stopping and starting.
customer_reviews.author: George Knighton

customer_reviews.title: Good for regular cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: Is nice product for your house/apartment but only for dust, hair and small food crumbs. We usually turned on when we are out of the apartment from our phone so when we go back the apartment is “clean” the point is if you’re looking for a vacuum to do everything this is not the one. We have the robot but also and extra regular hand vacuum for areas where roomba can get in. Is definitely high good quality, easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.author: Lina Arango

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's so refreshing to see this vacuum doing my work as I'm chilling in the tub. It found a ball of yarn on the floor and tried to suck it up. It simply turned itself off. When I picked it up, it told me to clear the rollers, so I did and it takes off cleaning again. My house is cleaner, and I'm more relaxed. It's picks up tons of cat dander and fur-even in recently cleaned rooms that appeared clean but apparently were not. I absolutely love my e5 roomba. Great investment so far. Update: Started leaving hair clumps behind after a few weeks and not picking up as much. Cleaned the air filter and we’re back in business!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picks up well on wood floors.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate, was little hard to sync with iPhone. Now Alice cleans until needs to recharge the back to base.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum, terrible parts
customer_reviews.text: This is great so far, but man the new brushes are weak! I’ve had to replace them twice in the four months I’ve had this roomba. They are soft and hair or strings that get tangled just cut right through the rollers. One of them just broke off and is somehow missing a solid half inch of the brush. No idea how it happened or where it went, but I have to put it away until I can get another set of replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Lar

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as old Roomba with brushes
customer_reviews.text: This is a good vacuum but it is not like my old Roomba which had brushes not rubber rollers. This room a does not tell you the trash bin is full like my old one did, does not go on my son’s rug like my old one did and leaves rolled up chunks of animal hair on my living room floor rug. I have talked to tech support and they sent new rubber rollers. I would of rather had my old Roomba but gave it to my mom. Suction is good.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: Omgggg....we love our Rosie the robot. This is such a great addition to the family lol. This cleans very nicely. We run it almost daily as we have hardwoods and a few throw tugs throughout the house. Even when the floors look clean we are amazed at what Rosie is able to find to still clean up. Easy app for remote use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good at NEETO brand
customer_reviews.text: We bought to replace our older NEETO robot vacuum, it does not make transition to area rugs and has a hard time when you do put on there to clean. Doesn't seem to memorize the lay out of the house like the NEETO did and seems to struggle zooming around in odd angles not getting everything done in one area before moving on to the next. I do like the little broom things that get against the walls and corners. Not very time efficient. Battery does last but shouldn't have to run as long. I wouldn't recommend, I would have stuck with the Consumer Reports and stayed with the NEETO brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pick up dog hair you never knew you had
customer_reviews.text: We own an high end vacuum cleaner and vacuum once a week, but weren't sure we were really getting up all the dog hair. WE WEREN'T. The Roomba ran once and I checked the bin because I was curious and I could have stuffed a pillow with all the dust and hair it picked up from the floor and rug in our bedroom alone. We just got it so I can't say too much about durability, but the app makes it easy to schedule cleanings and the bin and brushes are easy to remove. Definitely worth it if you have allergies to pet hair or just want to make sure you are actually getting a pretty deep clean.
customer_reviews.author: jvini

customer_reviews.title: dustbuster on wheels
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning dust and hair is very good. We have Dalmatian pup that sheds a lot and cleanup is good. Downside Dirt bin is like a dust buster... small...need to empty daily. Emptying is difficult...must bang on side of trash can to empty, but usually have to dig out of collector with fingers At least one time per week must retrieve because it does not return home before battery dies. Manually placing unit on charging dock is difficult. ...may have to reposition five or six times to make charging connection rubber cleaning rollers are great cleaners, but are very fragile... have had to replace frequently... need to pre-sweep floor to get pieces larger than dust off floor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Donart

customer_reviews.title: Like it or hate it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that is powerful enough to pick up most of the things on the floor, but you’ll be compromising sound(it’s loud) not as much as a regular vacuum but is loud. And also will bump into your furniture very hard. Had to come up with some soft padding for the front bumper, because my furniture was getting scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac M.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good like any Roomba
customer_reviews.text: I've had another Roomba before this. this one is probably better for dog hair, at least it's easier to clean out. Like all Roombas, don't watch them clean because it will drive you nuts - when they go over the same spot 5 times and haven't hit another spot once yet. I like that it has the remote that shows that it's charging because my last Roomba, you never knew...it could be on the base but not on correctly so it wasn't really charging - this remote will tell you that it is. It's a good helper with a dog that sheds a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kiefer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Just very noisy and a little "lost".
customer_reviews.text: I like Josh (that's the name I gave it. No particular reason. Just the first name that popped up in my head). He is able to get lots of dust that are almost invisible to the eyes. What I don't like about it is that it is very, very noisy (I don't even know if there are silent versions of these roombas), and also because it is a little "dumb", since it just wanders around the house kind of "randomly", so it ends up cleaning the same spot several times, while not cleaning other spots. And that also causes it to take much longer to complete the service. But, overall, I like Josh.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy.  My mom wants to give the robot a name.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. My mom wants to give the robot a name. Sweeps real well. Gets the job done without having to revert to the really expensive models that map out your house for you. I love the rubber rollers on the bottom since they do not get tangled with hair they way the brushes do. ALso, this model is real easy to clean. all the brushes come off really easy and the hair that get pulled up wraps around the side of the roller. So this vacuum allows you to remove the roller and slip the bundle of hair off the spindle and into the trash!! No sitting there pulling hair out of the rollers!!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Romero

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but can use improvements
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the fantastic suction power this vacuum has. Couple things I think would enhance this vacuum. Doesn’t seem to follow a pattern of cleaning. Kind of goes where it wants. Also it would be really nice if the app had a feature where you can direct the vacuum. Larger container for dirt would be nice too. Other than these couple things, decent vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my order of this Roomba. Was recommended to purchase this one from a friend. We have a boxer so she doesn't shed much but our 14mo old daughter drops stuff on the floor all the time. Our Roomba "Ellie" has been very helpful in picking stuff up off the floor so our daughter doesn't try to eat it lol. Easy to clean out and take care of. I love the app too. Easy to use and schedule cleanings throughout the day - which we don't use very often because she scares the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning and for my health.
customer_reviews.text: I was born with a slightly imperfect hip, which makes using a broom or even a vacuum cleaner somewhat painful to me. Thanks to Roomba, that is not a problem anymore. This is my 3rd Roomba. The first two never failed or broke down, I replaced them just because I wanted a newer model. I am very happy with this one. Great price, it's excellent for my dog's hair (she really sheds a lot. A LOT!) and it picks up all the dust on the floor. For my own amusement, I named this one "Danger, Will Robinson", in loving tribute to the robot on the 60s TV show Lost in Space. An awesome robot, just like my Roomba : )
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid PG

customer_reviews.title: Inefficent for pet fur
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product as I was due for an upgrade from an older version, where I had to continually change the brushes. However, I'm very disappointed that this product does NOT doe a good job with pet fur. It tends to gather it up and spit it out in clumps. I've actually used my older version Roomba to go and clean up afterwards and it's pretty obvious that this model misses a lot, albeit it does not stop randomly like my older model did and has a long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love our Fifi
customer_reviews.text: There are two adults with no pets. The Roomba (Aka Fifi)is great for us. It keeps our EVP flooring and area rugs clean. Has no problems going over the rugs. I have long hair- and she picks up the hair without an issue. We clean her filter and bin after each use. The only negative is that we’ve not been able to sych her where she will work with Alexa all the time (sometimes she does sometimes she doesn’t) nor will she go home when her battery is low. I’ve not called customer service yet. Over all I’d highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: aileen oman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far this is great. It’s not gonna keep your house perfectly spotless but it helps out a lot. I have a house with two cats that shed and this does a lotttttt while I’m doing other household stuff. I let it go about the whole house and it hasn’t fallen off the stairs or gotten trapped anywhere. It goes on rugs pretty well but does it’s best on the wood floors. I let it run wild so it doesn’t find its way back to the charger. I need to program it’s more complex features. I have yet to use its Alexa or programmed integrations via the mobile app.
customer_reviews.author: sophy hackney

customer_reviews.title: My 7th roomba
customer_reviews.text: I have used roomba for many years, some of my older ones are still going. The other 6 roomba had the same basic bin design, this one's bin is different and I hate it! Every single time I remove the bin dirt and dog hair falls on the floor. I have got in the habit of emptying it just before it starts so that I don't have to see the dirt on the floor that fell out of the bin. So even though it is much quieter then my other ones and almost always finds it way home I would not by this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Ssnut

customer_reviews.title: Love my roomba
customer_reviews.text: Let’s just say 3 dogs and carpet... I need all the help I can get! This guy is awesome! I love being able to set a schedule with my phone. It works while I’m at work and I come home to clean floors. Really picks up a lot of stuff. When it gets too full it will start to leave big tuffs of dog hair behind but I just empty it every day and it doesn’t happen! I want more of them! I have had it for almost a year now and it’s been perfect no issues at all!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: 3 German shepherds approve
customer_reviews.text: I would buy this product again, and again, and again. I was exhausted with sweeping and vacuuming after working such long days, I took a plunge and just bought it. I have 3 dogs that shed... a lot. I felt like my house had tumble weeds of hair everywhere no matter how much I would clean. My floors have been absolutely spotless after purchasing this. I have to clean it once a day empty it, which isn’t hard and takes less than a minute. It takes care of all the dog hair, and makes my home feel so clean.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Just give them your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing at cleaning. It cleaned through most of the home (4 Bedrooms) and did an amazing job. We have a cat and it picked up the hair quite well. So far only ran it once (first try) and it is charging currently. I was not notified of the Bin being full. Though to be fair, I was so happy watching it clean my floor that I emptied it myself 3 times. Had a hard time getting it back to the dock, ran out of batteries and i had to carry it back so that it can start charging. Will update later after a few more runs! Scotty P - “No Ragrets”
customer_reviews.author: Omar Mendez

customer_reviews.title: One of the smartest purchases I've made for time saving
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs, one of which sheds a lot. I have a two story house. This is so easy to carry up the steps, unlike dragging the vacuum. It cleans up my pet's hair perfectly I am 100% pleased with this purchase. It saves me time and a lot of aggravation trying to get under things to vacuum. I use it daily in the areas we live in and it has cut the dust level in the air and on furniture. It helps with allergies due to dust. It is easy to take apart and remove anything that gets on the wheels. I DO NOT want to be without one now!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roomba.
customer_reviews.text: The first three times out the Roomba was learning and hit things multiple times and cleaned for over a hour and half. Week two she is cleaning under one hour and c getting in all the hard places. I love her and my hardwood floor feel clean. She is great at getting the litter in the crevices. I now want the Brava jet. Also if you do not have internet you can push the clean button on top and the Roomba will clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rayleen Buth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for smart home!
customer_reviews.text: This product overshot my expectations, I live in an apartment with 3 females, all with long hair, as well as a dog that sheds ALOT, this cleans up like nothing I've ever had before, easy to clean and easy to set up, I use this with my Google Home, and routine cleaning works amazing, from reviews online, i was a bit sceptical, but it works amazing on hardfloors such as hardwood and tile, and works even better on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Octon

customer_reviews.title: Not for dog hair
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because my dog was driving me crazy with his shedding, this is the main reason why I bought this roomba and it doesn’t work it makes it even worse, just crumbles the hair and makes it more obvious and noticeable and everything gets stuck in the brushes , after one week of use the green brushes started falling apart . Honestly if it was way cheaper I might be a little bit more fair with the reviews but for the price it’s just not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Jorge V.

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well, but it’s incredibly dumb.
customer_reviews.text: The vacuuming part of the e5 is great. Cleans well, seems to get everything up. It’s the intelligence part that is junk. It’s iadapt software doesn’t seem to learn anything. It wanders aimlessly, get stuck on almost everything, including rugs. I sat and watched it try to return to its base 3ft away for about 20 minutes. I finally just picked it up and stuck it on its base. I actually felt bad for how stupid it was. I gave it a month, but ultimately returned it as it couldn’t do anything it claimed.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Very very loud. Doesn’t pick up that mi h dust and dirt. Really dislike that it doesn’t follow a specific straight path when it cleans. Annoyingly roams all over the house with no purpose. Went with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mery

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Roomba!
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure - I am a Roomba fan. I have two Roombas and now, with this one - three. It is quieter than my old Roombas and cleans very well. My own personal merry maid. My only complaint is that the virtual wall is not included in the price of the this product (probably to make it less expensive for the consumer) and is not compatible with my old Roombas. Neither are the brushes and filters. Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Lubumba

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to cleaning arsenal
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, good suction and 45 min life on full charge. Will find it’s way back to charging station if power is low. It stops at times between rugs and bare surfaces with no alarm to alert you. It gets into places I usually miss, so it’s been a good addition to arsenal of cleaning instruments.
customer_reviews.author: dale dawson

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a Roomba user for many years. If the three we have owned, this one leaves me disappointed. The rubber brushes are useless on carpet. It leaves little wads of cat hair all over the place and I have to wander around and pick them all up. I clean the brushes after every single use, but it does this every time. It does seem to work nicely on the tile in the kitchen, but most of my house is carpeted.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holzhauer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Google Home, easy to set up, cleans really well
customer_reviews.text: Great additional vacuum for any house, I'm regretting not getting one earlier. It's plug-and-play to set up and intergrate with Google Home (although I had to figure out the voice commands) and the cleaning power is impressive. My one issue has been finding the best place to put the dock as it needs a fairly clear line-of-sight to get back or it gets lost. I wanted it more tucked away, but I think it's just a question of trial and error to find the best place that makes the most sense.
customer_reviews.author: howard ej packham

customer_reviews.title: Find a different model
customer_reviews.text: This robot never finds it back to home and will miss areas all together.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: iRobot Roomba E5 (5150) Robot Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This product is too new to know about its battery life, but it arrived in good shape and on time. and works as I expected it too. As others have noted it doesn't seem as sturdily built as my older iRobot Roomba was--it rattles and is noisier than I expected, but works about the same as far as I can tell. It uses older sensing technology and the cleaning pattern reflects that, but it has not been a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the app to work
customer_reviews.text: I've tried downloading the app to my Chromebook. It worked twice and then wouldn't boot up. I uninstalled the app and reinstalled it twice. It flashes a quick blank screen and then shuts down. So I tried installing it on my Samsung S-7 smartphone. It wouldn't download. So now, if I want to run the Roomba I have to manually start it up. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sherlockzz

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: This is first our first roomba. We have had a Mint for years. iRobot needs to adapt the GPS technology of Mint and put in these Roombas. I have to be home when this thing runs because it constantly gets stuck in the same places and sometimes just runs in circles for the whole cycle. When it moves around the suction is decent but this Roomba is a pain to constantly pull out from under places.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Love how the Roomba keeps the floor clean!
customer_reviews.text: Now that we’re all home all day social distancing, I thought the Roomba might help keep things cleaner. My husband was skeptical - he didn’t think it would be able to handle bumps and things, like going from hard wood onto rugs. He admits now how impressed he is with the Roomba. I LOVE it! It gets everywhere, has no trouble with bumps or cords, and the floors look great!
customer_reviews.author: Addie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough for pet fur
customer_reviews.text: Cleans a portion of dust and pet hair, but not powerful enough to properly clean a carpet. Even after running the vacuum multiple full cycles over a small room, the carpet still has a layer of pet hair visible everywhere. On top of that, much of the pet hair it does manage to suction up gets tangled and then deposited back onto the carpet in little clumps. Absolutely not a replacement for a corded vacuum. It also tends to find it's way under furniture far more easily than it can find its way back out, resulting in an inordinate amount of its cycle spent cleaning the least important parts of the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great with pet hair
customer_reviews.text: We got this vacuum to help cut down on dog hair. We have a golden retriever who sheds a lot. After having this vacuum for several weeks, I can see it’s doing the job! I programmed it to run three mornings a week and I manually start it 2-3 more times each week. It does leave a few clumps of dog hair here and there. I think it’s gathering up the hair and randomly the clump doesn’t get sucked into the machine. Nevertheless, picking up a random clump of hair is quick and easy. Still much easier than cleaning the loads of hair that used to be spread throughout our house.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K

customer_reviews.title: Yes yes yes!
customer_reviews.text: Ohhhh roomba (aka Mildred). We love you! My fiancé and I had been going back and forth on whether we wanted to buy a robot vacuum and we finally took the plunge. We have mostly hard floors and it works super well getting up all the cat hair from our three cats. It goes over rugs and room connectors (is that what they’re called? Lol) very well. Now don’t get me wrong, it is not perfect. But it gets 95% of everything. We run it every other day and absolutely love it! My fiancé says I have an “interesting” relationship with our roomba. Lol it’s great. Don’t hesitate. Buy the dang thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum sucks! (In a GREAT way)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas. She has always spent her weekends cleaning the house. We have a lot of tile and hardwood in a 2700sqft home. I figured this would be a great gift to allow her to spend her weekends doing more interesting/entertaining things. She loves it! We have 2 dogs in the house and this vacuum has no problem getting all the short hair and long hair. Definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kile

customer_reviews.title: Zuma
customer_reviews.text: Seriously this thing is awesome. We scheduled ours to clean once a day and like clock work it takes off. It is a little louder than I thought it would be so I dont recommended running it at night. Also make sure you have bigger stuff picked up. If something can't be sucked into the container it will give you an alert on your phone. The basket is easy to clean and the filter is just as simple. Now I just need a mop and I will never clean my floors again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C

customer_reviews.title: Battery died after three months
customer_reviews.text: The battery died after three months, and iRobot's customer service is... lackluster at best. I emailed them, which I still haven't received a reply to in over a week, and I attempted calling them today. Two hours of being on hold waiting for a representative before finally giving up. I've tried removing the battery, factory resetting, etc. and immediately on boot it just says "Charging Error 19". It doesn't seem to even *attempt* to charge the battery before issuing this error, which their site indicates is an error for when charging takes too long. It could at least make another attempt to charge before issuing the error again.
customer_reviews.author: // JSwag

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Stylish E5 compared to 690 model, but the 690 is more price friendly and works fine
customer_reviews.text: The E5 model is quieter and more stylish compared to the 690 model— we set up E5 and let it run for the grandparents’ house. For the value, however, I feel that the 690 model offers very comparable features for less the price. I personally opted for the 690 model because it can do what I want it to do at a lower price. But if price point isn't an issue, E5 has a more stylish look and less maintenance because of E5's rubber brush instead of the traditional brush.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Fan

customer_reviews.title: Smart Navigation Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Cleans well, but its all random. Its smart navigation isnt as smart as it seems. Sometimes it stays in one room and never makes it to the next
customer_reviews.author: amyliz

customer_reviews.title: Real time saver!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an i7 for downstairs, loved it so much I bought an e5 for our smaller upstairs. We have two cats that seem to stop shedding. Now thanks to our roombas our home has never been so clean.
customer_reviews.author: John Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Utter junk!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and returned it because it wouldn't leave a 3ft perimeter. Returned for another and its doing the same thing. Cleaned the cliff sensors and all wheels are unjammed. Im now apparently stuck with this because I am a few days past the return date. Save your money and stay away from this product
customer_reviews.author: Jersey5b

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for certain conditions!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has this product and while dog-sitting at her place I fell in love! Her place never seemed cleaner and so I wanted one for myself. Upon using it at my place however, things were different; I have area rugs and fairly large thresholds, and the Roomba seems unable to handle either. It gets stuck on the thresholds and actually drops debris while transitioning to rugs. I find myself following it around to give it a nudge ...or to vacuum up the dog hair it spits out along the rug perimeter. Easier for me to just vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Lafferty

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy a KIRBY buy a ROOMBA!!
customer_reviews.text: Rosa, as I have namerd her is AMAZING! It’s like have a full time house cleaner. My dog doesn’t like her, but she does a great job of keeping my house allergy free by picking up all the dog hair. I do have to empty her container pretty often, but ill do that any day then drag around this Kirby I spent thousands on! Rosa goes to work everyday at 9 am to maintain and make it not so hard on her lol. Get you a Rosa!
customer_reviews.author: Darcie

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE STOPPED WORKING // DEJO DE FUNCIONAR
customer_reviews.text: AVOID!! Stopped working after 4 months. I keep getting "charging error 11". I tried removing and placing the battery back as told but it doesn't work. Amazon won't help you after 30 days. The problem is yours. // EVITAR!! Dejó de funcionar a los 4 meses. Da error de carga 11. Ya probé quitar y volver a poner la batería pero sigue sin funcionar. Amazon no se hace cargo después de 30 días, el problema es tuyo si lo compras.
customer_reviews.author: Juan I.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient little horse
customer_reviews.text: A bit loud, but cleans and sucks very good. Filter gets dirtying fast thus you will have to replace more often, not all that cheap replacements. Bluetooth works great. Their customer service support was very good to work with. I purchased the The three-year warranty just in case in order to protect my investment. It will bump into your furniture a bit hard.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Would work well in European Roomba Races
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it was the robot, but it took over an hour to clean around the island, in the middle of the floor. Kept turning right, going under the stools, hitting the baseboard. I bought this particular robot because my mother has one that she has had for 2 1/2 years. Hers runs great, vacuums her entire 1500 sq. ft. house, and returns home. The robot lost its way, never found its charging base. Ran the battery down cleaning around the island 15 feet away from the base. Mine, got a great tour around the island for over an hour. NEVER, EVER again. Maybe it need a vacation, and didn't understand that this island had no palm trees or sand.
customer_reviews.author: William Beeler

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for Black Carpet!
customer_reviews.text: Come on iRobot! You can do better! It’s great that you have stairway sensors for people who have stairs, but what about those of us who have black carpet? You need to provide a way to disable the sensors so my Roomba does not freak out and stop working on black carpet! Let me know when you do that. Until then, no more Roomba for me!
customer_reviews.author: GloriaStella

customer_reviews.title: So torn, holds up better then two lesser models
customer_reviews.text: I have tried out two models under this one and an off brand. This one gets over taller carpet and other things easier and seems easier to clean but the spin brushes are constantly breaking and the trash tank seems a lot smaller. It can never find its home and always dies in random spots.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Robby the Robot bit the dust.
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to getting this unit. My husbands office is in our house on the first floor. We have 2 labs and I set this unit up to vacuum every night at 2 am. Well It would leave rolled up dog hair everywhere. They looked like eyebrows. I would take the roller tape thing ( we call it Mr Sticky) and go all over the floor. Well one of my dogs had an accident and Robby sucked it up and it was all over the office. Its like it waited until it got in the office and left a real mess.
customer_reviews.author: L. Spikes

customer_reviews.title: Better roomba for the price
customer_reviews.text: Has much more suction and gets a lot more dust and cat hair than my older model at a reasonable price. I'm sure the more expensive models have even more suction, but this one works for me. I have mostly wall to wall carpet and it gathers an amazing amount of cat hair. I have the older model with the bristle brushes upstairs now and it does well on my hardwood and vinyl flooring.
customer_reviews.author: basketlady

customer_reviews.title: Smart little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I just received the Roomba E5 today. It was easy to set up. I started it just after setting it up even though the battery hadn't been charged and it ran for 5/6 minutes and then returned to the base by itself to charge. It did a great job manuvering around the furniture. I would highly recommend it as of now. Will update after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L

customer_reviews.title: Get Less than you Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this device, but very disappointed with the execution. The hard part about reviewing is that it does everything it's supposed to do on paper - just not very well. It picks up pet fur, but not very well. It gets carpet, but not very well. The suction works, just not very well. All the parts are there, it just feels like a bait and switch to get to you buy a better, more expensive model. Great idea, poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: chivesdd

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine. The only enemy of the Roomba is my girlfriends hair. The hair jammed every moving part of the Roomba. Need to clean it often to prevent bigger failure. Otherwise phenomenal. Use it daily! Old house with pets. Not a single carpet though. Just single level hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: DjO

customer_reviews.title: Periodically stops working
customer_reviews.text: Works well when it is functioning. Since I got it the green wheels underneath that suck everything up periodically stop working. It says something is stuck and then nothing is there when I try and clean. I’ll give the machine a bit and turn on again and it will work. Frustrating but when it’s working it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle McGlone

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer, handles pet hair
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired cat who leaves snowballs all over the carpet. every. day. I want to be clear that I use the Roomba in addition to a regular vacuum, but I do not have the time to haul out the big vacuum every day. I let the Roomba do the daily clean up, and it does just fine. I live in a 2b4/2ba < 1000sq ft. and the battery life is enough to clean the whole place.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Green

customer_reviews.title: Awesome- especially if you have allergies to dust mites!
customer_reviews.text: While I prefer the earlier model in terms of making carpets look fantastic, this model also works well, though I reserve it for my hardwood floors. I have 3 iRobots, 2 for downstairs and 1 for upstairs, in a 6800 sq ft house. I bought them as I have sever allergies to dust mites and running these daily, in combination with an IQ Air machine, has definitely allowed me to reduce medication use. I do ask my husband to empty them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Room prep
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it claims, e.g. clears well on low height carpet and hard surfaces. Easy to clean, easy to operate, and pretty darn cool. The only downside is that you must prep the rooms first or it gets stuck under things, electrical cords, blankets that drape to the floor, etc. It has a more difficult time with high plus carpet but still does a decent job even over throw rugs on top of carpeting.
customer_reviews.author: David B Spaeth

customer_reviews.title: Worst Rob Vac from iRobot
customer_reviews.text: I have a lower cost model of iRobot which works great. Decided to buy the upgraded one for my downstairs, which is hardwood floor and no pets. (1) Doesn't vacuum as good as the lower cost model which I still use upstairs (2) Battery doesn't last as long as the lower cost model (3) Doesn't navigate as well as the lower cost model, gets stuck every day I am trying to return this one.
customer_reviews.author: A. V. Ramanathan

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: This roomba is a good dude. It’s a little loud but my best friend. I have two German shepherd/ husky mixes and a blue heeler so I clean my floors twice a day and being able to tag team it with this guy makes my life so much easier. My only other advice is if you do have dogs with thick fur like me be mindful that you’ll probably have to clean out the brushes underneath, it will get clogged. But it’s still a 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Jilian grundig

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of furniture in our rooms. Has a little bit of a rough time finding its way around all the tables with chairs. I usually carry it to different levels. Makes it back to base 1 out of 3 runs which depends on which room it is in when ending a cleaning cycle. Does a pretty good job on hard surfaces. I think when running over carpet it uses up the battery more quickly. Really like that it cleans under beds. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest dumb robot that roomba makes. If you have a large house don't waste your money. This robot will not return to the base, charge, then continue to clean. On a fun note my kids like playing find the robot. I bought an i7 and I love it. The E5 works well just wont finish the job. Again. If you have a 1000+ sq foot space. Save your money and get an I series. You will be much happier
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for us
customer_reviews.text: Cleans everything.. will miss something's. But if you use everyday you probably never have to sweep lol except against walls and tight corners. Does well on my hardwood and carpet transition.. make sure u pick up small toys and wires.. empty after every use... no problems except my dog attacks it if I'm not around lol... close to ur ownership and no problems
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great but if U can spring for the next model up do it.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought the next model up for the mapping quality. This just runs into stuff and turns. Does a good job when virtual walls are up keeping it in a room. Easy to clean unless it runs over dog poop. Then it’s a nightmare. Wish the wheels came off easy for an accident cleaning. Standard cleaning is a breeze tho.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Tabak

customer_reviews.title: Fan stopped after 35 days of purchase, of no use now
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of cons and a single pros: Pros: Worked well in initial 40 days Cons: 1. Today, 35 days after buying, its fan stopped working/rotating. So, it is not cleaning well like in first couple of weeks. Its of no use without fan working 2. Makes too much noise 3. Takes a lot of time to return back to home and mostly I need to put it manually to return back 4. It gets stuck at a lot of places like my standing fan or chairs and need manual intervention
customer_reviews.author: riti

customer_reviews.title: I didn't realize how much dust was on the floor
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this roomba on my carpet floor for the past few weeks, and I have to say - it works really well! I got a puppy 2 months ago, so having this really helped clean up her fur, dirt that she tracked, as well as random dust on my carpet. When I took the compartment out, I was so surprised to see how much was actually on my carpet. Really love the home feature as well! I haven't used the app yet, but once I do, i think I'll like this roomba even more!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy c.

customer_reviews.title: Good on Carpet, Terrible on Tile Floors
customer_reviews.text: Really loved the way this Roomba cleaned my upstair carpets. It picked up dirt even after I used my regular vacuum cleaner. But when I stuck it downstairs on an all tile floor, it succeeded in mostly spreading the dirt around. My floors still looked terrible and the dirt collecting canister was mostly empty.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking!!
customer_reviews.text: Battery power is poor. Not able to finish the job. Battery life is supposed to be 90 minutes...have had this product for roughly a week and will only go 60 minutes at most. Keeps going over the same areas and missing the other half of the house. Very disappointed in this product!!
customer_reviews.author: CT

product_meta.title: iRobot Roomba E5 (5150) Robot Vacuum - Wi-Fi Connected, Works with Alexa, Ideal for Pet Hair, Carpets, Hard, Self-Charging Robotic Vacuum, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Roomba E5The Roomba e5 Robot Vacuum is packed with performance for powerful pickup. The premium 3-Stage Cleaning System cleans the dirt and pet hair you see—and the allergens and dust you don't. Intelligent sensors guide the robot throughout your home, navigating under and around furniture to help thoroughly clean your floors. Just press CLEAN or schedule Roomba on the go with the iRobot HOME App.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL PERFORMANCE AND POWERFUL PICK-UP - Pulls in stubborn dirt and messes with a Premium 3-Stage Cleaning System and 5X the Power-Lifting Suction. Control how you clean with the iRobot HOME app or your voice assistant.

IDEAL FOR HOMES WITH PETS - Unique Dual Multi-Surface Rubber Brushes don't get tangled with pet hair. Brushes adjust & flex to stay in constant contact with carpets & hard floors. High-Efficiency Filter traps 99% of cat & dog allergens.
LEARNS YOUR LIFE LISTENS TO YOUR VOICE - Learns your cleaning habits to offer up personalized schedules, while Google Assistant & Alexa allow you to start cleaning with just the sound of your voice.
ADAPTIVE NAVIGATION - A full suite of advanced sensors allow Roomba to navigate under & around furniture, & along edges. Cliff Detect keeps it from falling down stairs.
SENSES & ELIMINATES DIRT - Dirt Detect Sensors alert your robot about dirtier areas of your home, like high-traffic spots, & cleans them more thoroughly.
CLEAN FLOORS EVERYDAY - Provides a system of cleaning features & smart sensors that allow the robot to adjust to your unique home & deliver a daily clean.
CLEANS CARPETS & HARD FLOORS - Auto-Adjust Cleaning Head automatically adapts its height to effectively clean carpets & hard floors.
AUTOMATICALLY RECHARGES - Runs for up to 90 minutes before automatically docking & recharging.

iRobot does not certify the quality or authenticity of products purchased from non-authorized resellers, & will not cover claims, provide service or offer replacements for products purchased from these sellers.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,878 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
